DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Pharmacologic Substance Second Level Missing Value Reason Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes the reason why the second drug level value is missing.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Pharmacologic Substance Second Level
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._An active natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic ingredient including endogenous body substance that is intended to furnish pharmacological activity or other direct effect in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease or to affect the structure or any function of the human body, but does not include intermediates used in the synthesis of such ingredient (21 CFR 314.3(b))._Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude._A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:A natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic substance including endogenous body substance used to diagnose, prevent, maintain, treat or analyze abnormal and normal biological functions in vivo or in vitro.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.

Property.preferredDefinition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.:A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.  (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A specific reason explaining why a meaningful value is not available.  A meaningful value answers the question posed by a Data Element Concept.  In contrast, a Missing Value Reason answers the implicit question "Why is there no 'meaningful' value?", when there is none._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Capable of being estimated or expressed with numeric values.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Capable of being estimated or expressed with numeric values.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.: Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.: Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

In contrast, a Missing Value Reason answers the implicit question "Why is there no 'meaningful' value?", when there is none.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: A specific reason explaining why a meaningful value is not available. A meaningful value answers the question posed by a Data Element Concept. In contrast, a Missing Value Reason answers the implicit question "Why is there no 'meaningful' value?", when there is none.
